body: FYI, the travis-ci failure is irrelevant about this PR.
Done.
cc @zentol
@zentol @tzulitai Sorry for the delay. Rebased the branch with latest master and added documentation for the metrics. Let me know if that looks alright!
Further discussion about parallelizing the creation of InputSplit goes to [FLINK-10038](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-10038)
@suez1224  Would you please have a look this PR?
cc @tillrohrmann @zentol
@twalthr it solves my issue as well, good job!
@xueyumusic I merged FLINK-6846. Could you update this PR and use `-` arithmetic for the Table API?
Thanks, @twalthr , I will update this PR this weekend.

@buptljy  I don't agree. Without a test, we don't know whether the bug has been fixed.
As a choice you can use `NULLIF(uuid(), uuid()) IS NOT NULL` to test, i.e., the result should return true.
@zentol can you review this, so that I can start other issues and reuse the test file? thanks~
@liurenjie1024 Do you also want to have final look? The fix works in my cluster tests.
Thanks for review guys! I updated the PR.
Thanks for the PR @zjffdu. The way how tables are registered have change recently due to the new unified table sources/sinks. Could you update your PR? I will review it then.
We can close this PR as this is covered by #6484.
Thanks for the review @StefanRRichter! I have updated the PR.
Thanks for the update @yanghua. I'll have a final check and merge this.

@tillrohrmann I would appreciate if you take a look also. In last commit all the concerns has been address regarding using `SchemaCoder`. 

Only remaining concern is passing `subject` to the `ConfluentRegistryAvroSerializationSchema` which related to how Confluent Schema Registry works. As this is only specific to `ConfluentRegistryAvroSerializationSchema` I believe it should be ok to pass `subject` to the ctor.
I think we should merge this PR also into the `release-1.6` branch @zentol.
Very good job, LGTM now and will merge once my travis build is green 👍
@zentol the test will be added after the PR : #6475 been merged

@xccui, I've updated the PR. 
Best.
This still needs a _python_ test to verify that all properties can be properly set and retrieved from the python side.
OK, Can you review PR #6475 so that I can write a test with Java?
@twalthr addressed the comments. Let me know what you think.
@suez1224 Hi, thanks for your PR. Only one question from my side: do we have any good ideas or plans about how to remove `AuxiliaryConverter` since calcite-1761 is fixed.
@walterddr can you review this PR?
cc @zentol @tillrohrmann

@lzqdename thanks for your PR!
this change makes sense. you could pay attention to the code style by looking at code around, and it would be better if you modify the information of PR as PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE suggested( it is the long text you paste above ).
It seems the `-` arithmetic is not very convenient for users. Maybe we need the `timestampDiff ` function?  @twalthr @xueyumusic
cc @twalthr @StephanEwen
@zentol added python test case, can you review this PR again?

@twalthr @hequn8128 I updated with the following
1. using `-` arithmetic to compute diff of two timestamps or dates, the result is milliseconds. The behavior is like `unix_timestamp('2018-07-05 10:00:00') - unix_timestamp('2018-07-03 09:00:00')`

2. For timestampDiff function, it looks that I have no good way to express the result interval unit using `-` right now, so just leave it orignal currently and only fixed some above feedbacks of @hequn8128 

Thanks
cc @twalthr @tzulitai
ping @tillrohrmann
And nice work on this, it's super tedious doing all this setup and tear down stuff, nice job :100:
cc @tillrohrmann @fhueske @tzulitai

@hequn8128 I'm not aware of any plans. Actually, I'm wondering if the community could just remove the logic in AuxiliaryConverter and just return the plan unmodified. Every project could implement their own conversion logic.
@zentol or @StephanEwen , I would highly appreciate if one of you guys could take a look to double-check that this makes sense.
If yes, I would also consider backporting to the 1.5 and 1.4 branch.
cc @GJL  @tillrohrmann

Sorry @xueyumusic you are right. I thought `TIMESTAMPDIFF` is similar to `TIMESTAMPADD`. But actually the parameters and logic are quite different. So yes, we should have a syntax `timestampDiff(TimeIntervalUnit.DAY, '2018-07-03'.toDate, '2018-07-04'.toDate)` instead.

I think this should be integrated with the existing event-time documentation at https://ci.apache.org/projects/flink/flink-docs-release-1.5/dev/event_time.html. As it is, we just add more information in a different place, thus scattering information even more.
But I'm super happy about someone consolidating/improving that part of the documentation 😃
Interesting. This looks correct. The comment in the code even says the stream should not be closed.

Does it make sense to set some sane default values here, if Java's defaults are a bit insane?

For example:
  - Handshake timeout could be higher. We have seen that this helps overloaded systems.
  - Would it make sense to minimize session caches and timeout? We never reconnect a TPC connection trying to "fast resume" an SSL session.

Thanks @twalthr for reviewing. Actually I was using `TableEnvironment.connect()` but got used to `writeToSink` style of defining sinks. I think as long as the `writeToSink` remains there, it is hard to prevent legacy code from using it, which would lead to confusion. 

I assumed that `KafkaTableSink` is internal class and change the API semantics causes no confusion (no one would actually invoke KafkaTableSink.configure() apart from internal classes). It is a quick way of resolving the issue and adding a query/sink filedTypes check as well. Please let me know if anything I was missing.
Closing this PR as we first have to determine whether this is an issue with Flink or not, which should be done in the JIRA.

This increased the minimum maven version from Maven 3.0 to Maven 3.1.

Do we want that? Some Linux distributions seem to have Maven 3.0.5 by default.

At the very least, we should update the enforcer rule, so that this gives us a clean error message at the beginning (min maven version), not some "plugin preconditions failed error" in the middle of complication.
@twalthr and @zentol Can you check this out?
Thanks for the review @zentol ! Merging :)

@StephanEwen The error that you currently should get is
```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal pl.project13.maven:git-commit-id-plugin:2.1.14:revision (default) on project flink-runtime_2.11: The plugin pl.project13.maven:git-commit-id-plugin:2.1.14 requires Maven version [3.1.1,) -> [Help 1]
```

This is effectively what the enforcer would print as well, albeit later.

When I merged this I was unaware that this bumps the minimum maven version. If we'd bump the plugin version further to 2.2.4 we would regain support for maven 3.0.X (see https://github.com/ktoso/maven-git-commit-id-plugin/releases/tag/v2.2.4).
Let's bump this version further if there are no side effects.
alternative we could downgrade to 2.1.9 and use property exclusions instead. I don't know which option is prefereable.

@buptljy Ok, you are right. Thanks for pointing it out.
How about add a test in `CalcITCase` in package of `org.apache.flink.table.runtime.stream.table`. 

```
  @Test
  def testUDFNotDeterministic(): Unit = {
    val env = StreamExecutionEnvironment.getExecutionEnvironment
    val tEnv = TableEnvironment.getTableEnvironment(env)
    StreamITCase.testResults = mutable.MutableList()
    val ds = StreamTestData.getSmall3TupleDataStream(env).toTable(tEnv).select(uuid())

    val results = ds.toAppendStream[Row]
    results.addSink(new StreamITCase.StringSink[Row])
    env.execute()

    assert(StreamITCase.testResults.distinct.size > 1)
  }
```
cc @hequn8128 @suez1224 @xccui
Preliminary test has been setup [here](https://github.com/zentol/flink-ci/commit/e17b4765b0685c8ffbe7d6edd6a692d35f52889f).
Closing this PR for now.
Hmm, I'm wondering why not upgrading to `2.2.4` given that it was released in December 2017. Have you tried it out and found a concrete problem or is it just a gut feeling @zentol?
LGMT 👍 merging.

I now saw the discussion on the ML but I still think we shouldn't make the situation worse by adding more different places for this information. Any Ideas how we can solve it?

cc @fhueske
Thank you @fhueske. I hope I could address you comments.
Thanks for the update. +1 to merge

I agree, there is some overlap with the existing docs. 
However, the document also includes a lot of valuable information that is not available in the docs but only in code comments.

I think we should come up with a good structure for the event-time docs and then move the content from the different places into this structure.
@aljoscha @fhueske would you like me to merge Generating Timestamps / Watermarks and Pre-defined Timestamp Extractors / Watermark Emitter pages into the new Details page?
cc'ing @pnowojski as he just merged #6076, which is in response to my initial questioning on this topic
+1, much cleaner now.  LGTM

Thanks for the reminder @xccui! 
I'll try to have a look this week.
merged
hi, @kl0u @twalthr Could you please help reviewing this?

cc @tillrohrmann make `fork-join-executor` `client-socket-work-pool` and `server-socket-work-pool` configurable, should the options be nest like current or flatten?

UPDATE: flatten config options
@twalthr conflicts and sql client test failure.
@hequn8128 Good idea! it's added now.
@aljoscha I've seen this post and had it in the first version, but as @NicoK pointed it out, when I tried this option it didn't work.
Thanks @yanghua. Forgot to run all tests before opening the PR. Should build now.
I would suggest to add a unit test that passes in an environment and checks that the setters and getters are propagated to the environment instance.

Hi @StefanRRichter , thanks for reminding , I will add java test cases and Python test cases. I recently added multiple Python APIs. The tests for these APIs are blocked in a PR: #6475  because I added two test files to the streaming environment. @zentol  hasn't had time to review the PR. Can you help me with the review? So that it can make progress smoothly?
@yanghua Thanks! Alright, let me take a look at #6475 later and see what I can do to help you.

@suez1224 please include the issue in commit such as

`[FLINK-9134] [table] Upgrade Calcite dependency to 1.17`

Otherwise no one knows what happened in this commit:

```
commit eb3a1741032795ab8db76b40c3614820a2529166 (HEAD -> master, upstream/master)
Author: Shuyi Chen <shuyi@uber.com>
Date:   Fri Jul 27 17:27:05 2018 -0700

    - remove AggregateReduceFunctionsRule copy in Flink repo.
    - incoporate calcite change in DATETIME_PLUS operator.
    - fix unittests.
    - fix SqlToRelConverter in Flink repo.
```
cc @StefanRRichter
This was resolved in #5559. I am closing this PR. Feel free to reopen this @dianfu if you disagree.
As @kl0u already mentioned this PR is very much outdated right now. Closing this PR.
Just one minor comment. Otherwise LGTM 👍
Thanks @StefanRRichter, addressed!
Update looks good from my side.
@maqingxiang could you regenerate the documentation?
@suez1224 @hequn8128 @xccui
Looks good to me! One thing that I am wondering is whether it makes sense that we currently don't revert the config if a test case fails? Wouldn't it make sense to revert the config in either case?

I believe we do always revert it.
```
# from test-runner-common.sh

function cleanup_proc {
    shutdown_all
    revert_default_config
}

trap cleanup_proc EXIT
```

I guess the explicit cleanup in `run_test` could be removed.
~Ah, I missed that! Probably makes sense to remove that at some point~ Nevermind, we still need it b.c. the successful test cases are not bound to the exit trap
